trans-unit.source: Represents an HTTP module that performs claims-based authorization.
This class enables claims-based authorization by serving as an HTTP module in the HTTP processing pipeline.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule"></xref> class.
Returns a value that indicates whether the requestor (principal) is authorized for the current request.
The claims authentication manager specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A> property is invoked to authorize the request.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the principal is authorized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if no claims authentication manager is associated with this module.
The <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal"></xref> associated with the request is not authorized.
Gets or sets the current claims authorization manager instance that is used by this module.
The claims authorization manager instance or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no claims authorization manager is associated with this module.
An attempt to set the property to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> occurs.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the module.
Initializes the module and prepares it to handle events from its [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] application object.
The application object that contains this module.
Initializes the module properties based on definitions in the configuration file.

Initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A> property from the claims authorization manager that is specified in configuration by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.ClaimsAuthorizationManager%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration> object set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object that is set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
You can specify the claims authentication manager in a configuration file through the [\<claimsAuthorizationManager\>](../Topic/%3CclaimsAuthorizationManager%3E.md) element.
Handles the HTTP pipeline <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplication.AuthorizeRequest"></xref> event
The source of the event.
The data for the event.
